roleset.name: affix attention on, focusing of attention
roleset.note: CONCENTRATE-V NOTES: Args 1 and 2 are reversed from 'focus'. (from concentrate.01-v)
CONCENTRATION-N NOTES: Corresponds with concentrate.01. Framed by anwen april 2011 (from concentration.01-n)
CONCENTRATED-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. Based on verb concentrate.01. (from concentrated.01-j)

role.descr: thing contrentrated, if separate from agent

example.name: most typical usage
example.text: The move also would allow the company to concentrate on core businesses, which include ceramic tile, floor coverings and furniture.
example.arg: on core businesses, which include ceramic tile, floor coverings and furniture

example.name: with thing concentrated
example.text: Hunter-1 wants *trace*-1 to concentrate its resources on the insurance business.

example.name: Arg0 and Arg1
example.text: John's concentration on studying the broader concepts of chicken farming helped him on his chicken-farming midterm.
example.arg: on the broader concepts of chicken farming

example.name: All args
example.text: She is concentrated on promoting Polish children's theatre abroad.
example.arg: on promoting Polish children's theatre abroad.

roleset.name: cause a reduction in volume (as of a liquid)
roleset.note: CONCENTRATE-V NOTES: This is mostly here to account for future adjectival usages like"concentrated orange juice". (from concentrate.02-v)
CONCENTRATION-N NOTES: Corresponds with concentrate.02. Framed by anwen april 2011 (from concentration.02-n)
CONCENTRATED-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from concentrated.02-j)

example.name: Both Args
example.text: The chemist's concentration of the fluid resulted in a very potent treatment.

example.name: Arg1 only
example.text: I am on very high dose vitamin C , besides my green multiple , that-2 *T*-2 is very concentrated compared top wimpy Centrum .

example.name: All args
example.text: Finally the liquid is concentrated by evaporation.
